intro: Piqueria standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican brittlebush, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Its yellow flowers bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Piqueria standleyi is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
